raw_text:
Willis sues over movie 'injury'
 
 Actor Bruce Willis is suing Revolution Studios over an injury he said he suffered while making Tears of the Sun.
 
 Willis is seeking medical expenses after he said he was hit in the head by a firework during the filming of the 2002 movie, produced by the firm. The lawsuit said the star has endured mental and physical injuries as a result of the alleged incident. "We are not able to comment on pending litigation," Revolution Studios spokesman Sean Dudas said.
 
 In Tears of the Sun Willis plays a US military commander who disobeys orders to try and help save a doctor and patients trapped in the Nigerian jungle. Directed by Antoine Fuqua, the film was poorly received by critics and did not perform strongly at the box office. According to the lawsuit, the injury was suffered during the firing of explosions as part of a special effect. The explosions, known as squibs, were intended to "simulate the appearance of bullets striking the ground". The lawsuit said Willis has endured "extreme mental, physical and emotional pain and suffering." There were no specific details on the injuries. While Willis does not seek specific monetary damages, the lawsuit noted that the star "was required to and did employ physicians and other medical personnel". It stated he will incur additional future medical expenses. The lawsuit said Revolution Studios and special effects foreman Joe Pancake "had a duty to Willis to ensure that the squibs were inspected, set up, placed and detonated in a safe manner, and to employ technicians who were trained and competent in their use".
llama3.2:1b: Bruce Willis is suing Revolution Studios over an injury he claims occurred during filming of the 2002 movie Tears of the Sun. He alleges he was hit by a firework that caused physical and mental injuries, including extreme pain and suffering. The lawsuit seeks medical expenses and additional future medical costs.
llama3.2:3b: Bruce Willis is suing Revolution Studios over an injury he claimed to have sustained while filming Tears of the Sun. He alleges he was hit in the head by a firework during filming and has endured mental and physical injuries as a result. The lawsuit seeks medical expenses, including future costs, from Revolution Studios and special effects foreman Joe Pancake.
gemma2:2b: Bruce Willis is suing Revolution Studios for injuries he suffered while filming "Tears of the Sun." The lawsuit claims he was hit by a firework during filming and that this caused both physical and emotional harm. He is seeking reimbursement for medical expenses and expects to incur further costs.
qwen2.5:0.5b: Actor Bruce Willis sues Revolution Studios for injuries he suffered during the production of his 2002 film "Tears of the Sun." The lawsuit alleges Willis sustained mental and physical injuries after an alleged explosion during special effects filming, which occurred during the burning of firework displays. The claim asserts Willis is required to employ medical personnel due to the special effects, will incur additional expenses for future medical care, and requested damages in the form of punitive damages against Revolution Studios.
qwen2.5:1.5b: Actor Bruce Willis sues Revolution Studios for injury sustained while filming Tears of the Sun. He claims mental and physical injuries from being hit by a firework during special effects. The lawsuit seeks medical expenses and future care costs due to alleged negligence. No specific details are provided on his injuries, but he demands additional funding for ongoing treatment.
qwen2.5:3b: Actor Bruce Willis sues Revolution Studios for injuries sustained while filming Tears of the Sun in 2002. Willis claims he was hit by a firework during shooting, resulting in mental and physical trauma. The lawsuit alleges negligence in handling special effects squibs intended to simulate bullet impacts. Willis seeks unspecified medical expenses and additional treatment costs, blaming Revolution Studios and special effects supervisor Joe Pancake for inadequate safety measures.
opencoder:1.5b: The lawsuit alleges that Willis has sustained multiple injuries during the shooting of the 2002 movie. The first injury, although minor and fatal, provoked emotional panic and consequent suffering. The second incident, the killing of a patient trapped in a jungle, also involved severe physical trauma. The suiters requested medical expenses, but have nonetheless sought no particular monetary sum. The filmmakers' comments about the film's poor reception and its failure to perform at the box office are equally valid points to raise. While Willis does not comment on pending lawsuits, he also did not seek specific financial damages.

tinyllama:1.1b: Actress-turned-Actor Bruce Willis is suing Revolution Studios for allegedly injuring him during the filming of Tears of the Sun. The incident reportedly occurred during the production when a firework hit him on his head, leaving him with mental and physical injuries. Willis's attorney is seeking medical expenses as well as monetary damages totaling $10 million. The suit claims that Willis was required to use special effects foreseen for, but failed to receive proper inspection, setup, placement, and detonation of squibs used in the film. The injuries suffered by Willis reportedly occurred during the firing of explosions as part of a special effect. The suit also states that Willis has endured "extreme mental, physical, and emotional pain and suffering."
tinydolphin:1.1b: In the movie 'Tears of the Sun', actor Bruce Willis is suing Revolution Studios for causing him physical and mental injuries during filming. The lawsuit alleges that while making the action-adventure film, Willis was hit in the head by a firework, which caused him to suffer a head injury and severe pain. He has also endured numerous medical expenses due to his injuries. The lawsuit states that the studio should have properly inspected and set up the explosives used in the film, ensuring they were securely detonated and safe for Willis's use. If the studio is found responsible for any of the injuries, it may face legal consequences and be held accountable for their actions in the case.
